Description: Rim, wall, foot and floor sherd of Attic black-glazed pottery plate; rounded, incurving rim offset on exterior; bevelled foot, concave on interior with grooved resting surface; cyma profile, grooved at top; wholly glazed; impressed decoration on interior consisting of two preserved linked palmettes within rouletting.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Akademisches Kunstmuseum. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Piekarski 2001 / p.48 no. D16 pl. 21.4 Compare Rotroff, Agora XXIX no. 633 pl. 60.
Bibliographic references: Piekarski 2001 / Die Keramik aus Naukratis im Akademischen Kunstmuseum Bonn (p.48, no. D16, pl. 21.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (ID.041)
